intro: Impatiens bomiensis, commonly known as the Bomi impatiens, is a species of flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Yunnan Province in China. It belongs to the family Balsaminaceae and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments and has hairy stems and broad, ovate leaves. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in gardens and greenhouses. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
